title: Former Studio Chief Michael Nathanson Appointed Rewilding America Now CEO/Managing Director Demonstrating ... - PR Newswire
summary: Former Hollywood studio chief Michael Nathanson has been appointed CEO of Rewilding America Now (RAN), a non-profit organization dedicated to preserving wild horses and promoting environmental conservation. RAN is in the process of acquiring 400,000 acres of grazing lands in Idaho to rewild, and Nathanson's first spotlight will be the Rewilding Idaho project, which aims to create a wildlife corridor that will enlarge Yellowstone National Park.

title: Two Studies Make the Case For Eating a Lot More Plants for Your Health and the Planet - VegNews
summary: Two recent studies have found that plant-based diets offer significant benefits for both human health and the environment. Replacing half of meat products with plant-based alternatives could reduce global agricultural pollution by a third by 2050, and plant-based diets have been linked to a reduced risk of heart disease and type 2 diabetes.

title: Bio-Link Introduces New Water Purification System, Revolutionizing Global Water Quality APAC - English - APAC - PR Newswire
summary: Hong Kong-based Bio-Link, supported by American Bio-Pro, has launched a cutting-edge reverse osmosis water purification system that combines ultrafiltration and reverse osmosis technologies to ensure every drop of water is of the purest standard. The system adheres to rigorous quality control measures and incorporates advanced filter membrane technology from Dow Chemical, USA, meeting the National Sanitation Foundation (NSF) standards in the US. Bio-Link's commitment to environmental conservation and sustainable practices includes the use of efficient membrane technology that significantly reduces wastewater.

title: Move Over, Los Angeles and NYC: These 3 City Council Votes Could Make Pittsburgh the New Vegan Capital - VegNews
summary: The Pittsburgh City Council is considering a series of groundbreaking animal rights bills that would implement significant changes in the city's approach to animal welfare. If passed, these measures would be the first to happen all at once in any US city and would include a ban on the sale and manufacture of fur products, the use of horse-drawn carriages, and the sale of foie gras.

green_product: TRUE, The proposed legislation targets the sale of foie gras, which is a product that has been criticized for its environmental impact and animal cruelty. Banning the sale of foie gras would promote more sustainable and ethical food choices.

title: Oji Holdings' Paper Production Wields SDGs Ideals to Forge New Paths | NIKKEI ESG Management Forum - 日経BP
summary: Oji Holdings Corp., a leading Japanese paper firm, is using FSC-certified paper for its home-use products and aims to have all its forests certified by 2030. The company is also developing new materials and pharmaceuticals from forest resources, and is focused on being active in pharmaceutical development. These initiatives are being driven by the drop in demand for printing paper, the firm's founding product, caused by the increased focus on electronic technology.

title: Councilor push ‘waste consciousness culture’ - Mindanao Times
summary: Councilor Ocampo is working to develop a culture of waste consciousness in Davao City, Philippines. He recently attended a training in Kitakyushu, Japan, where he learned about the importance of waste segregation at individual homes and how to educate children about proper waste disposal. Ocampo plans to model the circular economy policy of Japan in Davao City and will host the first-ever Barangay Solid Waste Management Summit in December 2023.

title: Capital market investment up by 8pc - Daily News
summary: The value of capital market investments in Tanzania has grown by 7.6% in a year due to a favorable investment environment and inclusive business policies. The country's capital markets are among the best-performing in Africa due to new products and innovations, including green bonds, social bonds, and Sukuk bonds. The Capital Market and Securities Authority (CMSA) is implementing a special strategy to provide Municipal and Subnational Bonds to Local Government Authorities (LGAs) and Public Institutions for bankable projects.
